segment_text: Isa Whitney, brother of the late Elias Whitney, D.D., Principal of the Theological College of St. George’s, was much addicted to opium.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: The habit grew upon him, as I understand, from some foolish freak when he was at college; for having read De Quincey’s description of his dreams and sensations, he had drenched his tobacco with laudanum in an attempt to produce the same effects.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: He found, as so many more have done, that the practice is easier to attain than to get rid of, and for many years he continued to be a slave to the drug, an object of mingled horror and pity to his friends and relatives.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: I can see him now, with yellow, pasty face, drooping lids, and pin-point pupils, all huddled in a chair, the wreck and ruin of a noble man.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: One night—it was in June, ’89—there came a ring to my bell, about the hour when a man gives his first yawn and glances at the clock.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: I sat up in my chair, and my wife laid her needle-work down in her lap and made a little face of disappointment.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: “A patient!” said she.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: “You’ll have to go out.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: I groaned, for I was newly come back from a weary day.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: We heard the door open, a few hurried words, and then quick steps upon the linoleum.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: Our own door flew open, and a lady, clad in some dark-coloured stuff, with a black veil, entered the room.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: “You will excuse my calling so late,” she began, and then, suddenly losing her self-control, she ran forward, threw her arms about my wife’s neck, and sobbed upon her shoulder.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: “Oh, I’m in such trouble!” she cried; “I do so want a little help.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: “Why,” said my wife, pulling up her veil, “it is Kate Whitney.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: How you startled me, Kate! I had not an idea who you were when you came in.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: “I didn’t know what to do, so I came straight to you.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: That was always the way. Folk who were in grief came to my wife like birds to a lighthouse.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: “It was very sweet of you to come. Now, you must have some wine and water, and sit here comfortably and tell us all about it.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: Or should you rather that I sent James off to bed?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: “Oh, no, no! I want the doctor’s advice and help, too.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: It’s about Isa. He has not been home for two days.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: I am so frightened about him!”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: It was not the first time that she had spoken to us of her husband’s trouble, to me as a doctor, to my wife as an old friend and school companion.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: We soothed and comforted her by such words as we could find. Did she know where her husband was?
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: Was it possible that we could bring him back to her?
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: It seems that it was. She had the surest information that of late he had, when the fit was on him, made use of an opium den in the farthest east of the City.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: Hitherto his orgies had always been confined to one day, and he had come back, twitching and shattered, in the evening.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: But now the spell had been upon him eight-and-forty hours, and he lay there, doubtless among the dregs of the docks, breathing in the poison or sleeping off the effects.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: There he was to be found, she was sure of it, at the Bar of Gold, in Upper Swandam Lane.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: But what was she to do? How could she, a young and timid woman, make her way into such a place and pluck her husband out from among the ruffians who surrounded him?
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: There was the case, and of course there was but one way out of it. Might I not escort her to this place?
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: And then, as a second thought, why should she come at all? I was Isa Whitney’s medical adviser, and as such I had influence over him.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: I could manage it better if I were alone. I promised her on my word that I would send him home in a cab within two hours if he were indeed at the address which she had given me.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: And so in ten minutes I had left my armchair and cheery sitting-room behind me,
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian sitting-room, fireplace, armchairs.

segment_text: and was speeding eastward in a hansom on a strange errand, as it seemed to me at the time, though the future only could show how strange it was to be.
scene_description: nighttime, cobblestone street view, blurred gaslights, hansom cab motion.

segment_text: But there was no great difficulty in the first stage of my adventure.
scene_description: nighttime, cobblestone street view, blurred gaslights, hansom cab motion.

segment_text: Upper Swandam Lane is a vile alley lurking behind the high wharves which line the north side of the river to the east of London Bridge.
scene_description: nighttime, narrow dark alley, steep worn steps, flickering oil-lamp, grimy building facades.

segment_text: Between a slop-shop and a gin-shop, approached by a steep flight of steps leading down to a black gap like the mouth of a cave, I found the den of which I was in search.
scene_description: nighttime, narrow dark alley, steep worn steps, flickering oil-lamp, grimy building facades.

segment_text: Ordering my cab to wait, I passed down the steps, worn hollow in the centre by the ceaseless tread of drunken feet; and by the light of a flickering oil-lamp above the door I found the latch
scene_description: nighttime, narrow dark alley, steep worn steps, flickering oil-lamp, grimy building facades.

segment_text: and made my way into a long, low room, thick and heavy with the brown opium smoke, and terraced with wooden berths, like the forecastle of an emigrant ship.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: Through the gloom one could dimly catch a glimpse of bodies lying in strange fantastic poses, bowed shoulders, bent knees, heads thrown back, and chins pointing upward, with here and there a dark, lack-lustre eye turned upon the newcomer.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: Out of the black shadows there glimmered little red circles of light, now bright, now faint, as the burning poison waxed or waned in the bowls of the metal pipes.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: The most lay silent, but some muttered to themselves, and others talked together in a strange, low, monotonous voice, their conversation coming in gushes, and then suddenly tailing off into silence, each mumbling out his own thoughts and paying little heed to the words of his neighbour.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: At the farther end was a small brazier of burning charcoal, beside which on a three-legged wooden stool there sat a tall, thin old man, with his jaw resting upon his two fists, and his elbows upon his knees, staring into the fire.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: As I entered, a sallow Malay attendant had hurried up with a pipe for me and a supply of the drug, beckoning me to an empty berth.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: “Thank you. I have not come to stay,” said I.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: “There is a friend of mine here, Mr. Isa Whitney, and I wish to speak with him.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: There was a movement and an exclamation from my right, and peering through the gloom, I saw Whitney, pale, haggard, and unkempt, staring out at me.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: “My God! It’s Watson,” said he.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: He was in a pitiable state of reaction, with every nerve in a twitter. “I say, Watson, what o’clock is it?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: “Nearly eleven.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: “Of what day?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: “Of Friday, June 19th.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: “Good heavens! I thought it was Wednesday. It is Wednesday.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: What d’you want to frighten a chap for?” He sank his face onto his arms and began to sob in a high treble key.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: “I tell you that it is Friday, man. Your wife has been waiting this two days for you.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: You should be ashamed of yourself!”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: “So I am. But you’ve got mixed, Watson, for I have only been here a few hours, three pipes, four pipes—I forget how many.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: But I’ll go home with you. I wouldn’t frighten Kate—poor little Kate.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: Give me your hand! Have you a cab?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: “Yes, I have one waiting.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: “Then I shall go in it. But I must owe something.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: Find what I owe, Watson. I am all off colour.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: I can do nothing for myself.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: I walked down the narrow passage between the double row of sleepers, holding my breath to keep out the vile, stupefying fumes of the drug, and looking about for the manager.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: As I passed the tall man who sat by the brazier I felt a sudden pluck at my skirt, and a low voice whispered, “Walk past me, and then look back at me.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: The words fell quite distinctly upon my ear. I glanced down.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: They could only have come from the old man at my side, and yet he sat now as absorbed as ever, very thin, very wrinkled, bent with age, an opium pipe dangling down from between his knees, as though it had dropped in sheer lassitude from his fingers.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: I took two steps forward and looked back. It took all my self-control to prevent me from breaking out into a cry of astonishment.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: He had turned his back so that none could see him but I. His form had filled out, his wrinkles were gone, the dull eyes had regained their fire, and there, sitting by the fire and grinning at my surprise, was none other than Sherlock Holmes.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: He made a slight motion to me to approach him, and instantly, as he turned his face half round to the company once more, subsided into a doddering, loose-lipped senility.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: “Holmes!” I whispered, “what on earth are you doing in this den?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: “As low as you can,” he answered; “I have excellent ears.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: If you would have the great kindness to get rid of that sottish friend of yours I should be exceedingly glad to have a little talk with you.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: “I have a cab outside.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: “Then pray send him home in it. You may safely trust him, for he appears to be too limp to get into any mischief.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: I should recommend you also to send a note by the cabman to your wife to say that you have thrown in your lot with me. If you will wait outside, I shall be with you in five minutes.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: It was difficult to refuse any of Sherlock Holmes’ requests, for they were always so exceedingly definite, and put forward with such a quiet air of mastery.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: I felt, however, that when Whitney was once confined in the cab my mission was practically accomplished; and for the rest, I could not wish anything better than to be associated with my friend in one of those singular adventures which were the normal condition of his existence.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: In a few minutes I had written my note, paid Whitney’s bill,
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, smoky dim room, wooden berths, flickering oil lamps, charcoal brazier.

segment_text: led him out to the cab, and seen him driven through the darkness.
scene_description: nighttime, narrow dark alley, steep worn steps, flickering oil-lamp, grimy building facades.

segment_text: In a very short time a decrepit figure had emerged from the opium den,
scene_description: nighttime, narrow dark alley, steep worn steps, flickering oil-lamp, grimy building facades.

segment_text: and I was walking down the street with Sherlock Holmes.
scene_description: nighttime, victorian street, dim gaslights, closed shopfronts, cobblestones.

segment_text: For two streets he shuffled along with a bent back and an uncertain foot.
scene_description: nighttime, victorian street, dim gaslights, closed shopfronts, cobblestones.

segment_text: Then, glancing quickly round, he straightened himself out and burst into a hearty fit of laughter.
scene_description: nighttime, victorian street, dim gaslights, closed shopfronts, cobblestones.

segment_text: “I suppose, Watson,” said he, “that you imagine that I have added opium-smoking to cocaine injections, and all the other little weaknesses on which you have favoured me with your medical views.”
scene_description: nighttime, victorian street, dim gaslights, closed shopfronts, cobblestones.

segment_text: “I was certainly surprised to find you there.”
scene_description: nighttime, victorian street, dim gaslights, closed shopfronts, cobblestones.

segment_text: “But not more so than I to find you.”
scene_description: nighttime, victorian street, dim gaslights, closed shopfronts, cobblestones.

segment_text: “I came to find a friend.”
scene_description: nighttime, victorian street, dim gaslights, closed shopfronts, cobblestones.

segment_text: “And I to find an enemy.”
scene_description: nighttime, victorian street, dim gaslights, closed shopfronts, cobblestones.

segment_text: “An enemy?”
scene_description: nighttime, victorian street, dim gaslights, closed shopfronts, cobblestones.

segment_text: “Yes; one of my natural enemies, or, shall I say, my natural prey.
scene_description: nighttime, victorian street, dim gaslights, closed shopfronts, cobblestones.

segment_text: Briefly, Watson, I am in the midst of a very remarkable inquiry, and I have hoped to find a clue in the incoherent ramblings of these sots, as I have done before now.
scene_description: nighttime, victorian street, dim gaslights, closed shopfronts, cobblestones.

segment_text: Had I been recognised in that den my life would not have been worth an hour’s purchase; for I have used it before now for my own purposes, and the rascally Lascar who runs it has sworn to have vengeance upon me.
scene_description: nighttime, victorian street, dim gaslights, closed shopfronts, cobblestones.

segment_text: There is a trap-door at the back of that building, near the corner of Paul’s Wharf, which could tell some strange tales of what has passed through it upon the moonless nights.”
scene_description: nighttime, victorian street, dim gaslights, closed shopfronts, cobblestones.

segment_text: “What! You do not mean bodies?”
scene_description: nighttime, victorian street, dim gaslights, closed shopfronts, cobblestones.

segment_text: “Ay, bodies, Watson. We should be rich men if we had £ 1000 for every poor devil who has been done to death in that den.
scene_description: nighttime, victorian street, dim gaslights, closed shopfronts, cobblestones.

segment_text: It is the vilest murder-trap on the whole riverside, and I fear that Neville St. Clair has entered it never to leave it more.
scene_description: nighttime, victorian street, dim gaslights, closed shopfronts, cobblestones.

segment_text: But our trap should be here.” He put his two forefingers between his teeth and whistled shrilly—a signal which was answered by a similar whistle from the distance, followed shortly by the rattle of wheels and the clink of horses’ hoofs.
scene_description: nighttime, victorian street, dim gaslights, closed shopfronts, cobblestones.

segment_text: “Now, Watson,” said Holmes, as a tall dog-cart dashed up through the gloom, throwing out two golden tunnels of yellow light from its side lanterns.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “You’ll come with me, won’t you?”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “If I can be of use.”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “Oh, a trusty comrade is always of use; and a chronicler still more so.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: My room at The Cedars is a double-bedded one.”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “The Cedars?”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “Yes; that is Mr. St. Clair’s house. I am staying there while I conduct the inquiry.”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “Where is it, then?”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “Near Lee, in Kent. We have a seven-mile drive before us.”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “But I am all in the dark.”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “Of course you are. You’ll know all about it presently. Jump up here.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: All right, John; we shall not need you. Here’s half a crown.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: Look out for me to-morrow, about eleven. Give her her head.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: So long, then!”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: He flicked the horse with his whip, and we dashed away through the endless succession of sombre and deserted streets, which widened gradually, until we were flying across a broad balustraded bridge, with the murky river flowing sluggishly beneath us.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: Beyond lay another dull wilderness of bricks and mortar, its silence broken only by the heavy, regular footfall of the policeman, or the songs and shouts of some belated party of revellers.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: A dull wrack was drifting slowly across the sky, and a star or two twinkled dimly here and there through the rifts of the clouds.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: Holmes drove in silence, with his head sunk upon his breast, and the air of a man who is lost in thought, while I sat beside him, curious to learn what this new quest might be which seemed to tax his powers so sorely, and yet afraid to break in upon the current of his thoughts.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: We had driven several miles, and were beginning to get to the fringe of the belt of suburban villas, when he shook himself, shrugged his shoulders, and lit up his pipe with the air of a man who has satisfied himself that he is acting for the best.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “You have a grand gift of silence, Watson,” said he. “It makes you quite invaluable as a companion.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: ’Pon my word, it is a great thing for me to have someone to talk to, for my own thoughts are not over-pleasant.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: I was wondering what I should say to this dear little woman to-night when she meets me at the door.”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “You forget that I know nothing about it.”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “I shall just have time to tell you the facts of the case before we get to Lee. It seems absurdly simple, and yet, somehow I can get nothing to go upon.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: There’s plenty of thread, no doubt, but I can’t get the end of it into my hand. Now, I’ll state the case clearly and concisely to you, Watson, and maybe you can see a spark where all is dark to me.”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “Proceed, then.”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “Some years ago—to be definite, in May, 1884—there came to Lee a gentleman, Neville St. Clair by name, who appeared to have plenty of money.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: He took a large villa, laid out the grounds very nicely, and lived generally in good style.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: By degrees he made friends in the neighbourhood, and in 1887 he married the daughter of a local brewer, by whom he now has two children.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: He had no occupation, but was interested in several companies and went into town as a rule in the morning, returning by the 5:14 from Cannon Street every night.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: Mr. St. Clair is now thirty-seven years of age, is a man of temperate habits, a good husband, a very affectionate father, and a man who is popular with all who know him.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: I may add that his whole debts at the present moment, as far as we have been able to ascertain, amount to £ 88 10_s_., while he has £ 220 standing to his credit in the Capital and Counties Bank.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: There is no reason, therefore, to think that money troubles have been weighing upon his mind.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “Last Monday Mr. Neville St. Clair went into town rather earlier than usual, remarking before he started that he had two important commissions to perform, and that he would bring his little boy home a box of bricks.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: Now, by the merest chance, his wife received a telegram upon this same Monday, very shortly after his departure, to the effect that a small parcel of considerable value which she had been expecting was waiting for her at the offices of the Aberdeen Shipping Company.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: Now, if you are well up in your London, you will know that the office of the company is in Fresno Street, which branches out of Upper Swandam Lane, where you found me to-night.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: Mrs. St. Clair had her lunch, started for the City, did some shopping, proceeded to the company’s office, got her packet, and found herself at exactly 4:35 walking through Swandam Lane on her way back to the station.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: Have you followed me so far?”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “It is very clear.”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “If you remember, Monday was an exceedingly hot day, and Mrs. St. Clair walked slowly, glancing about in the hope of seeing a cab, as she did not like the neighbourhood in which she found herself.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: While she was walking in this way down Swandam Lane, she suddenly heard an ejaculation or cry, and was struck cold to see her husband looking down at her and, as it seemed to her, beckoning to her from a second-floor window.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: The window was open, and she distinctly saw his face, which she describes as being terribly agitated.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: He waved his hands frantically to her, and then vanished from the window so suddenly that it seemed to her that he had been plucked back by some irresistible force from behind.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: One singular point which struck her quick feminine eye was that although he wore some dark coat, such as he had started to town in, he had on neither collar nor necktie.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “Convinced that something was amiss with him, she rushed down the steps—for the house was none other than the opium den in which you found me to-night—and running through the front room she attempted to ascend the stairs which led to the first floor.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: At the foot of the stairs, however, she met this Lascar scoundrel of whom I have spoken, who thrust her back and, aided by a Dane, who acts as assistant there, pushed her out into the street.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: Filled with the most maddening doubts and fears, she rushed down the lane and, by rare good-fortune, met in Fresno Street a number of constables with an inspector, all on their way to their beat.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: The inspector and two men accompanied her back, and in spite of the continued resistance of the proprietor, they made their way to the room in which Mr. St. Clair had last been seen.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: There was no sign of him there. In fact, in the whole of that floor there was no one to be found save a crippled wretch of hideous aspect, who, it seems, made his home there.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: Both he and the Lascar stoutly swore that no one else had been in the front room during the afternoon.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: So determined was their denial that the inspector was staggered, and had almost come to believe that Mrs. St. Clair had been deluded when, with a cry, she sprang at a small deal box which lay upon the table and tore the lid from it.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: Out there fell a cascade of children’s bricks. It was the toy which he had promised to bring home.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “This discovery, and the evident confusion which the cripple showed, made the inspector realise that the matter was serious.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: The rooms were carefully examined, and results all pointed to an abominable crime.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: The front room was plainly furnished as a sitting-room and led into a small bedroom, which looked out upon the back of one of the wharves.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: Between the wharf and the bedroom window is a narrow strip, which is dry at low tide but is covered at high tide with at least four and a half feet of water.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: The bedroom window was a broad one and opened from below. On examination traces of blood were to be seen upon the windowsill, and several scattered drops were visible upon the wooden floor of the bedroom.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: Thrust away behind a curtain in the front room were all the clothes of Mr. Neville St. Clair, with the exception of his coat. His boots, his socks, his hat, and his watch—all were there.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: There were no signs of violence upon any of these garments, and there were no other traces of Mr. Neville St. Clair.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: Out of the window he must apparently have gone for no other exit could be discovered, and the ominous bloodstains upon the sill gave little promise that he could save himself by swimming, for the tide was at its very highest at the moment of the tragedy.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “And now as to the villains who seemed to be immediately implicated in the matter. The Lascar was known to be a man of the vilest antecedents, but as, by Mrs. St. Clair’s story, he was known to have been at the foot of the stair within a very few seconds of her husband’s appearance at the window, he could hardly have been more than an accessory to the crime.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: His defence was one of absolute ignorance, and he protested that he had no knowledge as to the doings of Hugh Boone, his lodger, and that he could not account in any way for the presence of the missing gentleman’s clothes.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “So much for the Lascar manager. Now for the sinister cripple who lives upon the second floor of the opium den, and who was certainly the last human being whose eyes rested upon Neville St. Clair.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: His name is Hugh Boone, and his hideous face is one which is familiar to every man who goes much to the City.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: He is a professional beggar, though in order to avoid the police regulations he pretends to a small trade in wax vestas.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: Some little distance down Threadneedle Street, upon the left-hand side, there is, as you may have remarked, a small angle in the wall.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: Here it is that this creature takes his daily seat, cross-legged with his tiny stock of matches on his lap, and as he is a piteous spectacle a small rain of charity descends into the greasy leather cap which lies upon the pavement beside him.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: I have watched the fellow more than once before ever I thought of making his professional acquaintance, and I have been surprised at the harvest which he has reaped in a short time.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: His appearance, you see, is so remarkable that no one can pass him without observing him.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: A shock of orange hair, a pale face disfigured by a horrible scar, which, by its contraction, has turned up the outer edge of his upper lip, a bulldog chin, and a pair of very penetrating dark eyes, which present a singular contrast to the colour of his hair, all mark him out from amid the common crowd of mendicants and so, too, does his wit, for he is ever ready with a reply to any piece of chaff which may be thrown at him by the passers-by.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: This is the man whom we now learn to have been the lodger at the opium den, and to have been the last man to see the gentleman of whom we are in quest.”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “But a cripple!” said I. “What could he have done single-handed against a man in the prime of life?”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “He is a cripple in the sense that he walks with a limp; but in other respects he appears to be a powerful and well-nurtured man.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: Surely your medical experience would tell you, Watson, that weakness in one limb is often compensated for by exceptional strength in the others.”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “Pray continue your narrative.”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “Mrs. St. Clair had fainted at the sight of the blood upon the window, and she was escorted home in a cab by the police, as her presence could be of no help to them in their investigations.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: Inspector Barton, who had charge of the case, made a very careful examination of the premises, but without finding anything which threw any light upon the matter.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: One mistake had been made in not arresting Boone instantly, as he was allowed some few minutes during which he might have communicated with his friend the Lascar, but this fault was soon remedied, and he was seized and searched, without anything being found which could incriminate him.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: There were, it is true, some blood-stains upon his right shirt-sleeve, but he pointed to his ring-finger, which had been cut near the nail, and explained that the bleeding came from there, adding that he had been to the window not long before, and that the stains which had been observed there came doubtless from the same source.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: He denied strenuously having ever seen Mr. Neville St. Clair and swore that the presence of the clothes in his room was as much a mystery to him as to the police.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: As to Mrs. St. Clair’s assertion that she had actually seen her husband at the window, he declared that she must have been either mad or dreaming.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: He was removed, loudly protesting, to the police-station, while the inspector remained upon the premises in the hope that the ebbing tide might afford some fresh clue.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “And it did, though they hardly found upon the mud-bank what they had feared to find.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: It was Neville St. Clair’s coat, and not Neville St. Clair, which lay uncovered as the tide receded.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: And what do you think they found in the pockets?”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “I cannot imagine.”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “No, I don’t think you would guess. Every pocket stuffed with pennies and half-pennies—421 pennies and 270 half-pennies.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: It was no wonder that it had not been swept away by the tide. But a human body is a different matter.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: There is a fierce eddy between the wharf and the house. It seemed likely enough that the weighted coat had remained when the stripped body had been sucked away into the river.”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “But I understand that all the other clothes were found in the room. Would the body be dressed in a coat alone?”
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: “No, sir, but the facts might be met speciously enough. Suppose that this man Boone had thrust Neville St. Clair through the window, there is no human eye which could have seen the deed.
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: What would he do then?
scene_description: nighttime, dog-cart moving, deserted streets, murky river, cloudy sky.

segment_text: It would of course instantly strike him that he must get rid of the tell-tale garments.
scene_description: nighttime, country road, hedgerows, scattered village lights.

segment_text: He would seize the coat, then, and be in the act of throwing it out, when it would occur to him that it would swim and not sink.
scene_description: nighttime, country road, hedgerows, scattered village lights.

segment_text: He has little time, for he has heard the scuffle downstairs when the wife tried to force her way up, and perhaps he has already heard from his Lascar confederate that the police are hurrying up the street.
scene_description: nighttime, country road, hedgerows, scattered village lights.

segment_text: There is not an instant to be lost.
scene_description: nighttime, country road, hedgerows, scattered village lights.

segment_text: He rushes to some secret hoard, where he has accumulated the fruits of his beggary, and he stuffs all the coins upon which he can lay his hands into the pockets to make sure of the coat’s sinking.
scene_description: nighttime, country road, hedgerows, scattered village lights.

segment_text: He throws it out, and would have done the same with the other garments had not he heard the rush of steps below, and only just had time to close the window when the police appeared.”
scene_description: nighttime, country road, hedgerows, scattered village lights.

segment_text: “It certainly sounds feasible.”
scene_description: nighttime, country road, hedgerows, scattered village lights.

segment_text: “Well, we will take it as a working hypothesis for want of a better.
scene_description: nighttime, country road, hedgerows, scattered village lights.

segment_text: Boone, as I have told you, was arrested and taken to the station, but it could not be shown that there had ever before been anything against him.
scene_description: nighttime, country road, hedgerows, scattered village lights.

segment_text: He had for years been known as a professional beggar, but his life appeared to have been a very quiet and innocent one.
scene_description: nighttime, country road, hedgerows, scattered village lights.

segment_text: There the matter stands at present, and the questions which have to be solved—what Neville St. Clair was doing in the opium den, what happened to him when there, where is he now, and what Hugh Boone had to do with his disappearance—are all as far from a solution as ever.
scene_description: nighttime, country road, hedgerows, scattered village lights.

segment_text: I confess that I cannot recall any case within my experience which looked at the first glance so simple and yet which presented such difficulties.”
scene_description: nighttime, country road, hedgerows, scattered village lights.

segment_text: While Sherlock Holmes had been detailing this singular series of events, we had been whirling through the outskirts of the great town until the last straggling houses had been left behind, and we rattled along with a country hedge upon either side of us.
scene_description: nighttime, country road, hedgerows, scattered village lights.

segment_text: Just as he finished, however, we drove through two scattered villages, where a few lights still glimmered in the windows.
scene_description: nighttime, country road, hedgerows, scattered village lights.

segment_text: “We are on the outskirts of Lee,” said my companion.
scene_description: nighttime, country road, hedgerows, scattered village lights.

segment_text: “We have touched on three English counties in our short drive, starting in Middlesex, passing over an angle of Surrey, and ending in Kent.
scene_description: nighttime, country road, hedgerows, scattered village lights.

segment_text: See that light among the trees? That is The Cedars, and beside that lamp sits a woman whose anxious ears have already, I have little doubt, caught the clink of our horse’s feet.”
scene_description: nighttime, country road, hedgerows, scattered village lights.

segment_text: “But why are you not conducting the case from Baker Street?” I asked.
scene_description: nighttime, large villa, gravel driveway, illuminated doorway.

segment_text: “Because there are many inquiries which must be made out here. Mrs. St. Clair has most kindly put two rooms at my disposal, and you may rest assured that she will have nothing but a welcome for my friend and colleague.
scene_description: nighttime, large villa, gravel driveway, illuminated doorway.

segment_text: I hate to meet her, Watson, when I have no news of her husband. Here we are. Whoa, there, whoa!”
scene_description: nighttime, large villa, gravel driveway, illuminated doorway.

segment_text: We had pulled up in front of a large villa which stood within its own grounds.
scene_description: nighttime, large villa, gravel driveway, illuminated doorway.

segment_text: A stable-boy had run out to the horse’s head, and springing down, I followed Holmes up the small, winding gravel-drive which led to the house.
scene_description: nighttime, large villa, gravel driveway, illuminated doorway.

segment_text: As we approached, the door flew open, and a little blonde woman stood in the opening, clad in some sort of light mousseline de soie, with a touch of fluffy pink chiffon at her neck and wrists.
scene_description: nighttime, large villa, gravel driveway, illuminated doorway.

segment_text: She stood with her figure outlined against the flood of light, one hand upon the door, one half-raised in her eagerness, her body slightly bent, her head and face protruded, with eager eyes and parted lips, a standing question.
scene_description: nighttime, large villa, gravel driveway, illuminated doorway.

segment_text: “Well?” she cried, “well?”
scene_description: nighttime, large villa, gravel driveway, illuminated doorway.

segment_text: And then, seeing that there were two of us, she gave a cry of hope which sank into a groan as she saw that my companion shook his head and shrugged his shoulders.
scene_description: nighttime, large villa, gravel driveway, illuminated doorway.

segment_text: “No good news?”
scene_description: nighttime, large villa, gravel driveway, illuminated doorway.

segment_text: “None.”
scene_description: nighttime, large villa, gravel driveway, illuminated doorway.

segment_text: “No bad?”
scene_description: nighttime, large villa, gravel driveway, illuminated doorway.

segment_text: “No.”
scene_description: nighttime, large villa, gravel driveway, illuminated doorway.

segment_text: “Thank God for that. But come in. You must be weary, for you have had a long day.”
scene_description: nighttime, large villa, gravel driveway, illuminated doorway.

segment_text: “This is my friend, Dr. Watson. He has been of most vital use to me in several of my cases, and a lucky chance has made it possible for me to bring him out and associate him with this investigation.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “I am delighted to see you,” said she, pressing my hand warmly.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “You will, I am sure, forgive anything that may be wanting in our arrangements, when you consider the blow which has come so suddenly upon us.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “My dear madam,” said I, “I am an old campaigner, and if I were not I can very well see that no apology is needed.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: If I can be of any assistance, either to you or to my friend here, I shall be indeed happy.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Now, Mr. Sherlock Holmes,” said the lady as we entered a well-lit dining-room, upon the table of which a cold supper had been laid out, “I should very much like to ask you one or two plain questions, to which I beg that you will give a plain answer.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Certainly, madam.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Do not trouble about my feelings. I am not hysterical, nor given to fainting.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: I simply wish to hear your real, real opinion.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Upon what point?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “In your heart of hearts, do you think that Neville is alive?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes seemed to be embarrassed by the question.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Frankly, now!” she repeated, standing upon the rug and looking keenly down at him as he leaned back in a basket-chair.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Frankly, then, madam, I do not.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “You think that he is dead?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “I do.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Murdered?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “I don’t say that. Perhaps.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “And on what day did he meet his death?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “On Monday.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Then perhaps, Mr. Holmes, you will be good enough to explain how it is that I have received a letter from him to-day.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes sprang out of his chair as if he had been galvanised.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “What!” he roared.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Yes, to-day.” She stood smiling, holding up a little slip of paper in the air.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “May I see it?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Certainly.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: He snatched it from her in his eagerness, and smoothing it out upon the table he drew over the lamp and examined it intently.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: I had left my chair and was gazing at it over his shoulder.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: The envelope was a very coarse one and was stamped with the Gravesend postmark and with the date of that very day, or rather of the day before, for it was considerably after midnight.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Coarse writing,” murmured Holmes. “Surely this is not your husband’s writing, madam.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “No, but the enclosure is.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “I perceive also that whoever addressed the envelope had to go and inquire as to the address.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “How can you tell that?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “The name, you see, is in perfectly black ink, which has dried itself. The rest is of the greyish colour, which shows that blotting-paper has been used.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: If it had been written straight off, and then blotted, none would be of a deep black shade.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: This man has written the name, and there has then been a pause before he wrote the address, which can only mean that he was not familiar with it.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: It is, of course, a trifle, but there is nothing so important as trifles. Let us now see the letter.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: Ha! there has been an enclosure here!”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Yes, there was a ring. His signet-ring.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “And you are sure that this is your husband’s hand?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “One of his hands.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “One?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “His hand when he wrote hurriedly. It is very unlike his usual writing, and yet I know it well.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “‘Dearest do not be frightened. All will come well. There is a huge error which it may take some little time to rectify.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: Wait in patience.—NEVILLE.’ Written in pencil upon the fly-leaf of a book, octavo size, no water-mark. Hum!
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: Posted to-day in Gravesend by a man with a dirty thumb. Ha!
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: And the flap has been gummed, if I am not very much in error, by a person who had been chewing tobacco. And you have no doubt that it is your husband’s hand, madam?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “None. Neville wrote those words.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “And they were posted to-day at Gravesend. Well, Mrs. St. Clair, the clouds lighten, though I should not venture to say that the danger is over.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “But he must be alive, Mr. Holmes.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Unless this is a clever forgery to put us on the wrong scent. The ring, after all, proves nothing.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: It may have been taken from him.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “No, no; it is, it is his very own writing!”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Very well. It may, however, have been written on Monday and only posted to-day.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “That is possible.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “If so, much may have happened between.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Oh, you must not discourage me, Mr. Holmes. I know that all is well with him.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: There is so keen a sympathy between us that I should know if evil came upon him.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: On the very day that I saw him last he cut himself in the bedroom, and yet I in the dining-room rushed upstairs instantly with the utmost certainty that something had happened.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: Do you think that I would respond to such a trifle and yet be ignorant of his death?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “I have seen too much not to know that the impression of a woman may be more valuable than the conclusion of an analytical reasoner.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: And in this letter you certainly have a very strong piece of evidence to corroborate your view. But if your husband is alive and able to write letters, why should he remain away from you?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “I cannot imagine. It is unthinkable.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “And on Monday he made no remarks before leaving you?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “No.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “And you were surprised to see him in Swandam Lane?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Very much so.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Was the window open?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Yes.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Then he might have called to you?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “He might.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “He only, as I understand, gave an inarticulate cry?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Yes.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “A call for help, you thought?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Yes. He waved his hands.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “But it might have been a cry of surprise. Astonishment at the unexpected sight of you might cause him to throw up his hands?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “It is possible.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “And you thought he was pulled back?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “He disappeared so suddenly.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “He might have leaped back. You did not see anyone else in the room?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “No, but this horrible man confessed to having been there, and the Lascar was at the foot of the stairs.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Quite so. Your husband, as far as you could see, had his ordinary clothes on?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “But without his collar or tie. I distinctly saw his bare throat.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Had he ever spoken of Swandam Lane?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Never.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Had he ever showed any signs of having taken opium?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Never.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: “Thank you, Mrs. St. Clair. Those are the principal points about which I wished to be absolutely clear. We shall now have a little supper and then retire, for we may have a very busy day to-morrow.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, well-lit dining room, table with supper, victorian decor.

segment_text: A large and comfortable double-bedded room had been placed at our disposal, and I was quickly between the sheets, for I was weary after my night of adventure.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes was a man, however, who, when he had an unsolved problem upon his mind, would go for days, and even for a week, without rest, turning it over, rearranging his facts, looking at it from every point of view until he had either fathomed it or convinced himself that his data were insufficient.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: It was soon evident to me that he was now preparing for an all-night sitting.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: He took off his coat and waistcoat, put on a large blue dressing-gown, and then wandered about the room collecting pillows from his bed and cushions from the sofa and armchairs.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: With these he constructed a sort of Eastern divan, upon which he perched himself cross-legged, with an ounce of shag tobacco and a box of matches laid out in front of him.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: In the dim light of the lamp I saw him sitting there, an old briar pipe between his lips, his eyes fixed vacantly upon the corner of the ceiling, the blue smoke curling up from him, silent, motionless, with the light shining upon his strong-set aquiline features.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: So he sat as I dropped off to sleep, and so he sat when a sudden ejaculation caused me to wake up, and I found the summer sun shining into the apartment.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: The pipe was still between his lips, the smoke still curled upward, and the room was full of a dense tobacco haze, but nothing remained of the heap of shag which I had seen upon the previous night.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: “Awake, Watson?” he asked.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: “Yes.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: “Game for a morning drive?”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: “Certainly.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: “Then dress. No one is stirring yet, but I know where the stable-boy sleeps, and we shall soon have the trap out.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: He chuckled to himself as he spoke, his eyes twinkled, and he seemed a different man to the sombre thinker of the previous night.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: As I dressed I glanced at my watch. It was no wonder that no one was stirring. It was twenty-five minutes past four.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: I had hardly finished when Holmes returned with the news that the boy was putting in the horse.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: “I want to test a little theory of mine,” said he, pulling on his boots.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: “I think, Watson, that you are now standing in the presence of one of the most absolute fools in Europe. I deserve to be kicked from here to Charing Cross.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: But I think I have the key of the affair now.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: “And where is it?” I asked, smiling.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: “In the bathroom,” he answered. “Oh, yes, I am not joking,” he continued, seeing my look of incredulity.
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: “I have just been there, and I have taken it out, and I have got it in this Gladstone bag. Come on, my boy, and we shall see whether it will not fit the lock.”
scene_description: indoors, nighttime, victorian bedroom, double bed, lamplight.

segment_text: We made our way downstairs as quietly as possible, and out into the bright morning sunshine.
scene_description: outdoors, morning, large villa grounds, bright sunshine, gravel driveway.

segment_text: In the road stood our horse and trap, with the half-clad stable-boy waiting at the head.
scene_description: morning, country road transitioning to town, quiet villas, early carts.

segment_text: We both sprang in, and away we dashed down the London Road.
scene_description: morning, country road transitioning to town, quiet villas, early carts.

segment_text: A few country carts were stirring, bearing in vegetables to the metropolis, but the lines of villas on either side were as silent and lifeless as some city in a dream.
scene_description: morning, country road transitioning to town, quiet villas, early carts.

segment_text: “It has been in some points a singular case,” said Holmes, flicking the horse on into a gallop.
scene_description: morning, country road transitioning to town, quiet villas, early carts.

segment_text: “I confess that I have been as blind as a mole, but it is better to learn wisdom late than never to learn it at all.”
scene_description: morning, country road transitioning to town, quiet villas, early carts.

segment_text: In town the earliest risers were just beginning to look sleepily from their windows as we drove through the streets of the Surrey side.
scene_description: morning, country road transitioning to town, quiet villas, early carts.

segment_text: Passing down the Waterloo Bridge Road we crossed over the river, and dashing up Wellington Street wheeled sharply to the right and found ourselves in Bow Street.
scene_description: street view, morning, Bow Street, police station entrance, victorian buildings.

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes was well known to the force, and the two constables at the door saluted him.
scene_description: street view, morning, Bow Street, police station entrance, victorian buildings.

segment_text: One of them held the horse’s head while the other led us in.
scene_description: indoors, police station, stone-flagged passage, official-looking doors.

segment_text: “Who is on duty?” asked Holmes.
scene_description: indoors, police station, stone-flagged passage, official-looking doors.

segment_text: “Inspector Bradstreet, sir.”
scene_description: indoors, police station, stone-flagged passage, official-looking doors.

segment_text: “Ah, Bradstreet, how are you?” A tall, stout official had come down the stone-flagged passage, in a peaked cap and frogged jacket.
scene_description: indoors, police station, stone-flagged passage, official-looking doors.

segment_text: “I wish to have a quiet word with you, Bradstreet.”
scene_description: indoors, police station, stone-flagged passage, official-looking doors.

segment_text: “Certainly, Mr. Holmes. Step into my room here.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: It was a small, office-like room, with a huge ledger upon the table, and a telephone projecting from the wall.
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: The inspector sat down at his desk.
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: “What can I do for you, Mr. Holmes?”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: “I called about that beggarman, Boone—the one who was charged with being concerned in the disappearance of Mr. Neville St. Clair, of Lee.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: “Yes. He was brought up and remanded for further inquiries.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: “So I heard. You have him here?”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: “In the cells.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: “Is he quiet?”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: “Oh, he gives no trouble. But he is a dirty scoundrel.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: “Dirty?”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: “Yes, it is all we can do to make him wash his hands, and his face is as black as a tinker’s.
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: Well, when once his case has been settled, he will have a regular prison bath; and I think, if you saw him, you would agree with me that he needed it.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: “I should like to see him very much.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: “Would you? That is easily done. Come this way. You can leave your bag.”
scene_description: indoors, police station, whitewashed corridor, barred cell doors, winding stair.

segment_text: “No, I think that I’ll take it.”
scene_description: indoors, police station, whitewashed corridor, barred cell doors, winding stair.

segment_text: “Very good. Come this way, if you please.”
scene_description: indoors, police station, whitewashed corridor, barred cell doors, winding stair.

segment_text: He led us down a passage, opened a barred door, passed down a winding stair, and brought us to a whitewashed corridor with a line of doors on each side.
scene_description: indoors, police station, whitewashed corridor, barred cell doors, winding stair.

segment_text: “The third on the right is his,” said the inspector. “Here it is!”
scene_description: indoors, police station, whitewashed corridor, barred cell doors, winding stair.

segment_text: He quietly shot back a panel in the upper part of the door and glanced through.
scene_description: indoors, police station, whitewashed corridor, barred cell doors, winding stair.

segment_text: “He is asleep,” said he. “You can see him very well.”
scene_description: indoors, police station, whitewashed corridor, barred cell doors, winding stair.

segment_text: We both put our eyes to the grating.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: The prisoner lay with his face towards us, in a very deep sleep, breathing slowly and heavily.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: He was a middle-sized man, coarsely clad as became his calling, with a coloured shirt protruding through the rent in his tattered coat.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: He was, as the inspector had said, extremely dirty, but the grime which covered his face could not conceal its repulsive ugliness.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: A broad wheal from an old scar ran right across it from eye to chin, and by its contraction had turned up one side of the upper lip, so that three teeth were exposed in a perpetual snarl.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: A shock of very bright red hair grew low over his eyes and forehead.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “He’s a beauty, isn’t he?” said the inspector.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “He certainly needs a wash,” remarked Holmes. “I had an idea that he might, and I took the liberty of bringing the tools with me.”
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.
