segment_text: He opened the Gladstone bag as he spoke, and took out, to my astonishment, a very large bath-sponge.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “He! he! You are a funny one,” chuckled the inspector.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “Now, if you will have the great goodness to open that door very quietly, we will soon make him cut a much more respectable figure.”
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “Well, I don’t know why not,” said the inspector. “He doesn’t look a credit to the Bow Street cells, does he?”
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: He slipped his key into the lock, and we all very quietly entered the cell.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: The sleeper half turned, and then settled down once more into a deep slumber.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: Holmes stooped to the water-jug, moistened his sponge, and then rubbed it twice vigorously across and down the prisoner’s face.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “Let me introduce you,” he shouted, “to Mr. Neville St. Clair, of Lee, in the county of Kent.”
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: Never in my life have I seen such a sight. The man’s face peeled off under the sponge like the bark from a tree.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: Gone was the coarse brown tint! Gone, too, was the horrid scar which had seamed it across, and the twisted lip which had given the repulsive sneer to the face!
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: A twitch brought away the tangled red hair, and there, sitting up in his bed, was a pale, sad-faced, refined-looking man, black-haired and smooth-skinned, rubbing his eyes and staring about him with sleepy bewilderment.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: Then suddenly realising the exposure, he broke into a scream and threw himself down with his face to the pillow.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “Great heavens!” cried the inspector, “it is, indeed, the missing man. I know him from the photograph.”
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: The prisoner turned with the reckless air of a man who abandons himself to his destiny. “Be it so,” said he.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “And pray what am I charged with?”
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “With making away with Mr. Neville St.— Oh, come, you can’t be charged with that unless they make a case of attempted suicide of it,” said the inspector with a grin.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “Well, I have been twenty-seven years in the force, but this really takes the cake.”
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “If I am Mr. Neville St. Clair, then it is obvious that no crime has been committed, and that, therefore, I am illegally detained.”
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “No crime, but a very great error has been committed,” said Holmes.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “You would have done better to have trusted your wife.”
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “It was not the wife; it was the children,” groaned the prisoner. “God help me, I would not have them ashamed of their father.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: My God! What an exposure! What can I do?”
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes sat down beside him on the couch and patted him kindly on the shoulder.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “If you leave it to a court of law to clear the matter up,” said he, “of course you can hardly avoid publicity.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: On the other hand, if you convince the police authorities that there is no possible case against you, I do not know that there is any reason that the details should find their way into the papers.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: Inspector Bradstreet would, I am sure, make notes upon anything which you might tell us and submit it to the proper authorities.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: The case would then never go into court at all.”
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “God bless you!” cried the prisoner passionately. “I would have endured imprisonment, ay, even execution, rather than have left my miserable secret as a family blot to my children.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “You are the first who have ever heard my story. My father was a schoolmaster in Chesterfield, where I received an excellent education.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: I travelled in my youth, took to the stage, and finally became a reporter on an evening paper in London.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: One day my editor wished to have a series of articles upon begging in the metropolis, and I volunteered to supply them.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: There was the point from which all my adventures started. It was only by trying begging as an amateur that I could get the facts upon which to base my articles.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: When an actor I had, of course, learned all the secrets of making up, and had been famous in the green-room for my skill.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: I took advantage now of my attainments. I painted my face, and to make myself as pitiable as possible I made a good scar and fixed one side of my lip in a twist by the aid of a small slip of flesh-coloured plaster.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: Then with a red head of hair, and an appropriate dress, I took my station in the business part of the city, ostensibly as a match-seller but really as a beggar.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: For seven hours I plied my trade, and when I returned home in the evening I found to my surprise that I had received no less than 26_s_. 4_d_.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “I wrote my articles and thought little more of the matter until, some time later, I backed a bill for a friend and had a writ served upon me for £ 25.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: I was at my wit’s end where to get the money, but a sudden idea came to me.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: I begged a fortnight’s grace from the creditor, asked for a holiday from my employers, and spent the time in begging in the City under my disguise.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: In ten days I had the money and had paid the debt.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “Well, you can imagine how hard it was to settle down to arduous work at £ 2 a week when I knew that I could earn as much in a day by smearing my face with a little paint, laying my cap on the ground, and sitting still.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: It was a long fight between my pride and the money, but the dollars won at last, and I threw up reporting and sat day after day in the corner which I had first chosen, inspiring pity by my ghastly face and filling my pockets with coppers.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: Only one man knew my secret. He was the keeper of a low den in which I used to lodge in Swandam Lane, where I could every morning emerge as a squalid beggar and in the evenings transform myself into a well-dressed man about town.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: This fellow, a Lascar, was well paid by me for his rooms, so that I knew that my secret was safe in his possession.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “Well, very soon I found that I was saving considerable sums of money.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: I do not mean that any beggar in the streets of London could earn £ 700 a year—which is less than my average takings—but I had exceptional advantages in my power of making up, and also in a facility of repartee, which improved by practice and made me quite a recognised character in the City.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: All day a stream of pennies, varied by silver, poured in upon me, and it was a very bad day in which I failed to take £ 2.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “As I grew richer I grew more ambitious, took a house in the country, and eventually married, without anyone having a suspicion as to my real occupation.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: My dear wife knew that I had business in the City. She little knew what.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “Last Monday I had finished for the day and was dressing in my room above the opium den when I looked out of my window and saw, to my horror and astonishment, that my wife was standing in the street, with her eyes fixed full upon me.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: I gave a cry of surprise, threw up my arms to cover my face, and, rushing to my confidant, the Lascar, entreated him to prevent anyone from coming up to me.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: I heard her voice downstairs, but I knew that she could not ascend. Swiftly I threw off my clothes, pulled on those of a beggar, and put on my pigments and wig.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: Even a wife’s eyes could not pierce so complete a disguise. But then it occurred to me that there might be a search in the room, and that the clothes might betray me.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: I threw open the window, reopening by my violence a small cut which I had inflicted upon myself in the bedroom that morning.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: Then I seized my coat, which was weighted by the coppers which I had just transferred to it from the leather bag in which I carried my takings.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: I hurled it out of the window, and it disappeared into the Thames.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: The other clothes would have followed, but at that moment there was a rush of constables up the stair, and a few minutes after I found, rather, I confess, to my relief, that instead of being identified as Mr. Neville St. Clair, I was arrested as his murderer.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: “I do not know that there is anything else for me to explain. I was determined to preserve my disguise as long as possible, and hence my preference for a dirty face.
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text: Knowing that my wife would be terribly anxious, I slipped off my ring and confided it to the Lascar at a
scene_description: indoors, dim cell, prisoner's cot, stone walls.

segment_text:
moment when no constable was watching me, together with a hurried

scrawl, telling her that she had no cause to fear.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: “That note only reached her yesterday,” said Holmes.
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: “Good God! What a week she must have spent!”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text:
“The police have watched this Lascar,” said Inspector Bradstreet, “and

I can quite understand that he might find it difficult to post a letter

unobserved.
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text:
Probably he handed it to some sailor customer of his, who

forgot all about it for some days.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text:
“That was it,” said Holmes, nodding approvingly; “I have no doubt of

it.
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: But have you never been prosecuted for begging?”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: “Many times; but what was a fine to me?”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: “It must stop here, however,” said Bradstreet.
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text:
“If the police are to

hush this thing up, there must be no more of Hugh Boone.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text: “I have sworn it by the most solemn oaths which a man can take.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text:
“In that case I think that it is probable that no further steps may be

taken. But if you are found again, then all must come out.
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text:
I am sure,

Mr. Holmes, that we are very much indebted to you for having cleared

the matter up. I wish I knew how you reach your results.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text:
“I reached this one,” said my friend, “by sitting upon five pillows and

consuming an ounce of shag.
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.

segment_text:
I think, Watson, that if we drive to Baker

Street we shall just be in time for breakfast.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, desk with ledger, wall telephone.
